00020 // The implementation of the alldiff GAC algorithm,
00021 // shared between alldiffgacslow and dynamicalldiff.
00022 
00023 
00024 // whether to backtrack the matching.
00025 // This one is a slowdown.
00026 // #define BTMATCHING
00027 
00028 // This one seems to break even.
00029 // Whether to use a TMS to track whether spare values are present in the scc
00030 // #define SPAREVALUESOPT
00031 
00032 // Reverse the var list. Leave this switched on.
00033 #define REVERSELIST
00034 
00035 // Check domain size -- if it is greater than numvars, then no need to wake the constraint.
00036 //#define CHECKDOMSIZE
00037 
00038 // Process SCCs independently
00039 #define SCC
00040 
00041 // Warning: if this is not defined, then watchedalldiff probably won't do anything.
00042 //#define USEWATCHES
00043 
00044 // Optimize the case where a value was assigned. Only works in the presence of SCC
00045 #define ASSIGNOPT 
00046 
00047 // Use the special queue
00048 #define SPECIALQUEUE
00049 
00050 // store matching from one run to the next.
00051 #define INCREMENTALMATCH
00052 
00053 // Use BFS instead of HK
00054 #define BFSMATCHING
00055 
00056 // Use staging a la Schulte and Stuckey
00057 #define STAGED
00058 
00059 //Incremental graph -- maintains adjacency lists for values and vars
00060 //#define INCGRAPH
00061

00089 template<typename VarArray>
00090 struct GacAlldiff : public AbstractConstraint
00091 {
00092   virtual string constraint_name()
00093   { 
00094       return "GacAlldiff";
00095   }
00096   
00097   DomainInt dom_min, dom_max;
00098   VarArray var_array;
00099   
00100   int numvars, numvals;
00101   
00102   vector<int> SCCs;    // Variable numbers
00103   ReversibleMonotonicSet SCCSplit;
00104   // If !SCCSplit.isMember(anIndex) then anIndex is the last index in an SCC.
00105   
00106   //ReversibleMonotonicSet sparevaluespresent;
00107   
00108   D_DATA(MoveablePointer SCCSplit2);
00109   
00110   vector<int> varToSCCIndex;  // Mirror of the SCCs array.
00111   
00112   GacAlldiff(StateObj* _stateObj, const VarArray& _var_array) : AbstractConstraint(_stateObj),
00113     dom_min(0), dom_max(0),
00114     #ifndef REVERSELIST
00115     var_array(_var_array), 
00116     #else
00117     var_array(_var_array.rbegin(), _var_array.rend()),
00118     #endif
00119     numvars(0), numvals(0),
00120     SCCSplit(_stateObj, _var_array.size()), 
00121     //sparevaluespresent(_stateObj, _var_array.size()), 
00122     constraint_locked(false)
00123   {
00124       if(var_array.size()>0)
00125       {
00126           dom_min=var_array[0].getInitialMin();
00127           dom_max=var_array[0].getInitialMax();
00128       }
00129       SCCs.resize(var_array.size());
00130       varToSCCIndex.resize(var_array.size());
00131       for(int i=0; i<var_array.size(); ++i)
00132       {
00133           if(var_array[i].getInitialMin()<dom_min)
00134               dom_min=var_array[i].getInitialMin();
00135           if(var_array[i].getInitialMax()>dom_max)
00136               dom_max=var_array[i].getInitialMax();
00137           
00138           SCCs[i]=i;
00139           varToSCCIndex[i]=i;
00140           //D_ASSERT(SCCSplit.isMember(i));  // Can't do this until the thing is locked.
00141       }
00142       numvars=var_array.size();  // number of variables in the constraint
00143       numvals=dom_max-dom_min+1;
00144       
00145       to_process.reserve(var_array.size());
00146       
00147       // Set up data structures
00148       initialize_hopcroft();
00149       initialize_tarjan();
00150       
00151       // The matching in both directions.
00152       
00153       #ifndef BTMATCHING
00154       varvalmatching.resize(numvars); // maps var to actual value
00155       valvarmatching.resize(numvals); // maps val-dom_min to var.
00156       #else
00157       varvalmatching=getMemory(stateObj).backTrack().template requestArray<int>(numvars);
00158       valvarmatching=getMemory(stateObj).backTrack().template requestArray<int>(numvals);
00159       #endif
00160       
00161       sccs_to_process.reserve(numvars);
00162       
00163       // Initialize matching to satisfy the invariant
00164       // that the values are all different in varvalmatching.
00165       // watches DS is used in alldiffgacslow and in debugging.
00166       #if !defined(DYNAMICALLDIFF) || !defined(NO_DEBUG)
00167       if(usewatches()) watches.resize(numvars);
00168       #endif
00169       
00170       for(int i=0; i<numvars ; i++) //&& i<numvals
00171       {
00172           varvalmatching[i]=i+dom_min;
00173           if(i<numvals) valvarmatching[i]=i;
00174           
00175           #if !defined(DYNAMICALLDIFF) || !defined(NO_DEBUG)
00176           if(usewatches()) watches[i].reserve(numvals, stateObj);
00177           #endif
00178       }
00179       
00180       D_DATA(SCCSplit2=getMemory(stateObj).backTrack().request_bytes((sizeof(char) * numvars)));
00181       D_DATA(for(int i=0; i<numvars; i++) ((char *)SCCSplit2.get_ptr())[i]=1);
00182       
00183       #ifdef INCGRAPH
00184             // refactor this to use initial upper and lower bounds.
00185             adjlist.resize(numvars+numvals);
00186             adjlistpos.resize(numvars+numvals);
00187             for(int i=0; i<numvars; i++)
00188             {
00189                 adjlist[i].resize(numvals);
00190                 for(int j=0; j<numvals; j++) adjlist[i][j]=j+dom_min;
00191                 adjlistpos[i].resize(numvals);
00192                 for(int j=0; j<numvals; j++) adjlistpos[i][j]=j;
00193             }
00194             for(int i=numvars; i<numvars+numvals; i++)
00195             {
00196                 adjlist[i].resize(numvars);
00197                 for(int j=0; j<numvars; j++) adjlist[i][j]=j;
00198                 adjlistpos[i].resize(numvars);
00199                 for(int j=0; j<numvars; j++) adjlistpos[i][j]=j;
00200             }
00201             adjlistlength=getMemory(stateObj).backTrack().template requestArray<int>(numvars+numvals);
00202             for(int i=0; i<numvars; i++) adjlistlength[i]=numvals;
00203             for(int i=numvars; i<numvars+numvals; i++) adjlistlength[i]=numvars;
00204         #endif
00205   }
00206   
00207   #ifdef INCGRAPH
00208     vector<vector<int> > adjlist;
00209     MoveableArray<int> adjlistlength;
00210     vector<vector<int> > adjlistpos;   // position of a variable in adjlist.
00211   #endif
00212   
00213   // only used in dynamic version.
00214   int dynamic_trigger_count()
00215   {
00216     // First an array of watches for the matching, then a 2d array of mixed triggers
00217     // indexed by [var][count] where count is increased from 0 as the triggers are used.
00218     int numtrigs=0;
00219     #ifdef INCGRAPH
00220     numtrigs+=numvars*numvals; // one for each var-val pair so we know when it is removed.
00221     #endif
00222     
00223     #ifdef DYNAMICALLDIFF
00224     numtrigs+= numvars+numvars*numvals;
00225     #endif
00226     
00227     // Dynamic alldiff triggers go first, incgraph triggers are after that
00228     // so places which access incgraph triggers must check if DYNAMICALLDIFF is defined.
00229     return numtrigs;
00230   }
00231   
00232   #ifdef DYNAMICALLDIFF
00233   inline DynamicTrigger * get_dt(int var, int counter)
00234   {
00235       // index the square array of dynamic triggers from dt
00236       D_ASSERT(bt_triggers_start == dynamic_trigger_start()+numvars);
00237       D_ASSERT(counter<numvals);
00238       D_ASSERT(var<numvars);
00239       D_ASSERT((bt_triggers_start+(var*numvals)+counter) >= dynamic_trigger_start());
00240       D_ASSERT((bt_triggers_start+(var*numvals)+counter) < dynamic_trigger_start() + dynamic_trigger_count());
00241       
00242       return bt_triggers_start+(var*numvals)+counter;
00243   }
00244   #endif
00245   
00246   // Should only be used in non-dynamic version.
00247   #ifndef DYNAMICALLDIFF
00248   virtual triggerCollection setup_internal()
00249   {
00250     triggerCollection t;
00251     int array_size = var_array.size();
00252     for(int i = 0; i < array_size; ++i)
00253       t.push_back(make_trigger(var_array[i], Trigger(this, i), DomainChanged));
00254     return t;
00255   }
00256   #endif
00257   
00258   typedef typename VarArray::value_type VarRef;
00259   virtual AbstractConstraint* reverse_constraint()
00260   { // w-or of pairwise equality.
00261       vector<AbstractConstraint*> con;
00262       for(int i=0; i<var_array.size(); i++)
00263       {
00264           for(int j=i+1; j<var_array.size(); j++)
00265           {
00266               EqualConstraint<VarRef, VarRef>* t=new EqualConstraint<VarRef, VarRef>(stateObj, var_array[i], var_array[j]);
00267               con.push_back((AbstractConstraint*) t);
00268           }
00269       }
00270       return new Dynamic_OR(stateObj, con);
00271   }
00272   
00273   smallset to_process;  // set of vars to process.
00274   
00275   #if !defined(DYNAMICALLDIFF) || !defined(NO_DEBUG)
00276   vector<smallset_list_bt> watches;
00277   #endif
00278   
00279   #ifdef USEWATCHES
00280   inline bool usewatches()
00281   {
00282       return true;
00283   }
00284   #else
00285   inline bool usewatches()
00286   {
00287       return false;
00288   }
00289   #endif
00290   
00291   bool constraint_locked;
00292   
00293   virtual void propagate(int prop_var, DomainDelta)
00294   {
00295     D_ASSERT(prop_var>=0 && prop_var<var_array.size());
00296     
00297     // return if all the watches are still in place.
00298     #ifndef BTMATCHING 
00299     if(usewatches() && !to_process.in(prop_var) 
00300         && var_array[prop_var].inDomain(varvalmatching[prop_var]))     // This still has to be here, because we still wake up if the matchingis broken.
00301     #else
00302     if(usewatches() && !to_process.in(prop_var))
00303     #endif
00304     {
00305         smallset_list_bt& watch = watches[prop_var];
00306         short * list = ((short *) watch.list.get_ptr());
00307         int count=list[watch.maxsize];
00308         bool valout=false;
00309         
00310         for(int i=0; i<count; i++)
00311         {
00312             P("Checking var "<< prop_var << " val " << list[i]+dom_min);
00313             if(!var_array[prop_var].inDomain(list[i]+dom_min))
00314             {
00315                 valout=true;
00316                 break;
00317             }
00318         }
00319         if(!valout)
00320         {
00321             P("None of the watches were disturbed. Saved a call with watches.");
00322             return;
00323         }
00324     }
00325     #ifdef CHECKDOMSIZE
00326     // If the domain size is >= numvars, then return.
00327     //if(!constraint_locked)
00328     {
00329         int count=0;
00330         for(int i=var_array[prop_var].getMin(); i<=var_array[prop_var].getMax(); i++)
00331         {
00332             if(var_array[prop_var].inDomain(i))
00333             {
00334                 count++;
00335             }
00336         }
00337         if(count>=numvars)
00338             return;
00339     }
00340     // could improve domain counting by also applying it when
00341     // the constraint is already queued, DONE since it might avoid calls to Tarjan's.
00342     // i.e. some vars may not need to be queued in to_process.
00343     #endif
00344     
00345     #ifdef STAGED
00346     if(var_array[prop_var].isAssigned())
00347     {
00348         int assignedval=var_array[prop_var].getAssignedValue();
00349         for(int i=0; i<numvars; i++)
00350         {
00351             if(i!=prop_var)
00352             {
00353                 var_array[i].removeFromDomain(assignedval);
00354             }
00355         }
00356     }
00357     #endif
00358     
00359     if(!to_process.in(prop_var))
00360     {
00361         to_process.insert(prop_var);
00362     }
00363     
00364     if(!constraint_locked)
00365     {
00366         #ifdef SPECIALQUEUE
00367         constraint_locked = true;
00368         getQueue(stateObj).pushSpecialTrigger(this);
00369         #else
00370         #ifndef SCC
00371         do_prop_noscc();
00372         #else
00373         do_prop();
00374         #endif
00375         #endif
00376     }
00377   }
00378   
00379   virtual void propagate(DynamicTrigger* trig)
00380   {
00381       #ifdef INCGRAPH
00382       DynamicTrigger* dtstart=dynamic_trigger_start();
00383       #ifdef DYNAMICALLDIFF
00384       dtstart+=numvars+numvars*numvals;
00385       #endif
00386       if(trig>=dtstart && trig< dtstart+numvars*numvals)  // does this trigger belong to incgraph?
00387       {
00388           int diff=trig-dtstart;
00389             int var=diff/numvals;
00390             int validx=diff%numvals;
00391             if(adjlistpos[validx+numvars][var]<adjlistlength[validx+numvars])
00392             {
00393                 P("Removing var, val " << var << ","<< (validx+dom_min) << " from adjacency list.");
00394                 adjlist_remove(var, validx+dom_min); //validx, adjlistpos[validx][var]);
00395             }
00396             return;
00397       }
00398       #endif
00399       
00400       // get variable number from the trigger
00401     int prop_var = trig->trigger_info();
00402     #ifdef PLONG
00403     // check that some value has been disturbed; otherwise the watches are malfunctioning.
00404     if(var_array[prop_var].inDomain(varvalmatching[prop_var]))
00405     {
00406         smallset_list_bt& watch = watches[prop_var];
00407         short * list = ((short *) watch.list.get_ptr());
00408         int count=list[watch.maxsize];
00409         bool valout=false;
00410         
00411         for(int i=0; i<count; i++)
00412         {
00413             P("Checking var "<< prop_var << " val " << list[i]+dom_min);
00414             if(!var_array[prop_var].inDomain(list[i]+dom_min))
00415             {
00416                 valout=true;
00417                 break;
00418             }
00419         }
00420         if(!valout)
00421         {
00422             // none of the watches were disturbed.
00423             cout << "None of the watches in the DS were disturbed. BT triggers must not match with watches DS." <<endl;
00424             cout << "Variable " << prop_var <<", val in matching: " << varvalmatching[prop_var] << endl;
00425             D_ASSERT(false);
00426         }
00427     }
00428     #endif
00429     
00430     #ifdef CHECKDOMSIZE
00431     // If the domain size is >= numvars, then return.
00432     // WHY IS THIS HERE WHEN checkdomsize and dynamic triggers don't work together??
00433     int count=0;
00434     for(int i=var_array[prop_var].getMin(); i<=var_array[prop_var].getMax(); i++)
00435     {
00436         if(var_array[prop_var].inDomain(i))
00437         {
00438             count++;
00439         }
00440     }
00441     if(count>=numvars)
00442         return;
00443     #endif
00444     
00445     #ifdef STAGED
00446     if(var_array[prop_var].isAssigned())
00447     {
00448         int assignedval=var_array[prop_var].getAssignedValue();
00449         for(int i=0; i<numvars; i++)
00450         {
00451             if(i!=prop_var)
00452             {
00453                 var_array[i].removeFromDomain(assignedval);
00454             }
00455         }
00456     }
00457     #endif
00458     
00459     if(!to_process.in(prop_var))
00460     {
00461         to_process.insert(prop_var);
00462     }
00463     
00464     if(!constraint_locked)
00465     {
00466         #ifdef SPECIALQUEUE
00467         constraint_locked = true;
00468         getQueue(stateObj).pushSpecialTrigger(this);
00469         #else
00470         #ifndef SCC
00471         do_prop_noscc();
00472         #else
00473         do_prop();
00474         #endif
00475         #endif
00476     }
00477   }
00478   
00479   
00480   virtual void special_unlock() { constraint_locked = false; to_process.clear(); }
00481   virtual void special_check()
00482   {
00483     constraint_locked = false;  // should be above the if.
00484     
00485     if(getState(stateObj).isFailed())
00486     {
00487         to_process.clear();
00488         return;
00489     }
00490     
00491     #ifdef SCC
00492     do_prop();
00493     #else
00494     do_prop_noscc();
00495     #endif
00496     to_process.clear();
00497   }
00498   
00499   
00500   void do_prop()
00501   {
00502     PROP_INFO_ADDONE(AlldiffGacSlow);
00503     
00504     #ifdef DYNAMICALLDIFF
00505     bt_triggers_start=dynamic_trigger_start()+numvars;
00506     #endif
00507     
00508     #ifdef PLONG
00509     cout << "Entering do_prop."<<endl;
00510     cout << "Varvalmatching:" <<varvalmatching<<endl;
00511     cout << "SCCs:" << SCCs <<endl;
00512     cout << "SCCSplit: ";
00513     for(int i=0; i<numvars; i++)
00514     {
00515         cout << (SCCSplit.isMember(i)?"1, ":"0, ");
00516     }
00517     cout <<endl;
00518     cout << "varToSCCIndex: "<< varToSCCIndex<<endl;
00519     cout << "Domains (remember that var_array is reversed):" <<endl;
00520     for(int i=0; i<numvars; i++)
00521     {
00522         cout << "var:" << i << " vals:" ;
00523         for(int j=dom_min; j<=dom_max; j++)
00524         {
00525             if(var_array[i].inDomain(j))
00526             {
00527                 cout << j <<", ";
00528             }
00529         }
00530         cout << endl;
00531     }
00532     // Check the matching is valid.
00533     for(int i=0; i<numvars; i++)
00534     {
00535         if(!var_array[i].inDomain(varvalmatching[i]))
00536         {
00537             cout << "val in matching removed: " << i << ", " << varvalmatching[i] <<endl;
00538         }
00539         for(int j=i+1; j<numvars; j++)
00540         {
00541             D_ASSERT(varvalmatching[i]!=varvalmatching[j]);
00542             D_ASSERT(SCCs[i]!=SCCs[j]);
00543         }
00544         D_ASSERT(SCCSplit.isMember(i) == (((char*)SCCSplit2.get_ptr())[i]==1));
00545         cout << (int)SCCSplit.isMember(i) << ", " << (int) (((char*)SCCSplit2.get_ptr())[i]==1) << endl;
00546         // The matches correspond.
00547         #ifndef BFSMATCHING
00548         D_ASSERT(valvarmatching[varvalmatching[i]-dom_min]==i);
00549         #endif
00550     }
00551     
00552     #ifdef DYNAMICALLDIFF
00553     // Can't yet check all the watches are in the right place, but can check
00554     // there are the right number of them on each var.
00555     for(int i=0; i<var_array.size(); i++)
00556     {
00557         int count=0;
00558         DynamicTrigger* trig=get_dt(i, 0);
00559         while(trig->queue!=NULL && count<numvals)
00560         {
00561             count++;
00562             if(count<numvals) trig=get_dt(i,count);
00563         }
00564         D_ASSERT(count==watches[i].size());
00565     }
00566     #endif
00567     
00568     // Check that if an element of the matching is removed, then the var is 
00569     // in to_process.
00570     for(int i=0; i<var_array.size(); i++)
00571     {
00572         if(!var_array[i].inDomain(varvalmatching[i]))
00573         {
00574             D_ASSERT(to_process.in(i));
00575         }
00576     }
00577     #endif
00578     // end of debug.
00579     
00580     #ifndef INCREMENTALMATCH
00581     // clear the matching.
00582     for(int i=0; i<numvars && i<numvals; i++)
00583     {
00584       varvalmatching[i]=i+dom_min;
00585       valvarmatching[i]=i;
00586     }
00587     #endif
00588     
00589     sccs_to_process.clear();
00590     {
00591     vector<int>& toiterate = to_process.getlist();
00592     P("About to loop for to_process variables.");
00593     
00594     for(int i=0; i<toiterate.size(); ++i)
00595     {
00596         int tempvar=toiterate[i];
00597         
00598         
00599         int sccindex_start=varToSCCIndex[tempvar];
00600         int sccindex_end=varToSCCIndex[tempvar];
00601         
00602         while(sccindex_start>0 && SCCSplit.isMember(sccindex_start-1))
00603         {
00604             sccindex_start--;   // seek the first item in the SCC.
00605         }
00606         
00607         while(SCCSplit.isMember(sccindex_end) && sccindex_end<(numvars-1))
00608         {
00609             sccindex_end++;   // seek the last item in the SCC
00610         }
00611         
00612         if(!var_array[tempvar].inDomain(varvalmatching[tempvar]))
00613         {
00614             // Find the start of the SCC in SCCs
00615             var_indices.clear();
00616             
00617             // Add a greedy repair here.
00618             
00619             // Actually should queue the SCCs which need to be hopcrofted,
00620             // and make greedy repairs to var matchings as we process them here.
00621             
00622             P("Varvalmatching:" <<varvalmatching);
00623             
00624             P("start:" << sccindex_start << " end:"<< sccindex_end);
00625             
00626             if(!matching_wrapper(sccindex_start, sccindex_end))
00627                 return;
00628             
00629             #ifdef DYNAMICALLDIFF
00630             // sync the watches to the matching, 
00631             // since the matching has just changed.
00632             #ifndef BTMATCHING
00633             DynamicTrigger * trig = dynamic_trigger_start();
00634             for(int j=0; j<numvars; j++)
00635             {
00636                 var_array[j].addWatchTrigger(trig + j, DomainRemoval, varvalmatching[j]);
00637                 P("Adding watch for var " << j << " val " << varvalmatching[j]);
00638             }
00639             #endif
00640             #endif
00641             
00642             P("Fixed varvalmatching:" << varvalmatching);
00643             
00644             // now both varvalmatching and valvarmatching contain 
00645             // a complete matching for the SCC.
00646             // Also, valinlocalmatching contains the domain values
00647             // used in this SCC.
00648         }
00649         
00650         #ifdef ASSIGNOPT
00651         if(var_array[tempvar].isAssigned())  // Optimize the case where it is assigned.
00652         #else
00653         if(false)
00654         #endif
00655         {
00656             // Split tempvar off from the rest of the SCC
00657             if(SCCSplit.isMember(sccindex_start))
00658             {
00659                 // Swap it to the front.
00660                 //cout <<"Before swap:" <<SCCs<<endl;
00661                 sccs_to_process.remove(sccindex_start);
00662                 
00663                 int swapvar=SCCs[sccindex_start];
00664                 SCCs[sccindex_start]=SCCs[varToSCCIndex[tempvar]];
00665                 SCCs[varToSCCIndex[tempvar]]=swapvar;
00666                 
00667                 varToSCCIndex[swapvar]=varToSCCIndex[tempvar];
00668                 varToSCCIndex[tempvar]=sccindex_start;
00669                 
00670                 //cout <<"After swap:" <<SCCs <<endl;
00671                 //cout <<"varToSCCIndex:" << varToSCCIndex <<endl;
00672                 
00673                 // Split the SCCs
00674                 SCCSplit.remove(sccindex_start);
00675                 D_DATA(((char*)SCCSplit2.get_ptr())[sccindex_start]=0);
00676                 
00677                 sccindex_start++;
00678                 int tempval=var_array[tempvar].getAssignedValue();
00679                 
00680                 // Now remove the value from the reduced SCC
00681                 for(int i=sccindex_start; i<=sccindex_end; i++)
00682                 {
00683                     P("Removing var: "<< SCCs[i] << " val:" << tempval);
00684                     var_array[SCCs[i]].removeFromDomain(tempval);
00685                     if(getState(stateObj).isFailed()) return;
00686                 }
00687                 
00688                 if(sccindex_start<sccindex_end)
00689                 {
00690                     D_ASSERT(!sccs_to_process.in(sccindex_start));
00691                     sccs_to_process.insert(sccindex_start);
00692                 }
00693             }
00694             // Else: The SCC is unit anyway. Should be no work to do, and do not insert into sccs_to_process.
00695             
00696         }
00697         else
00698         {
00699             // Not assigned, just some vals removed, so 
00700             if(!sccs_to_process.in(sccindex_start) && sccindex_start<sccindex_end)
00701             {
00702                 sccs_to_process.insert(sccindex_start);
00703             }
00704         }
00705         
00706     } // end of loop.
00707     }
00708     
00709     
00710     #ifndef NO_DEBUG
00711     // Check the matching is valid.
00712     for(int i=0; i<numvars; i++)
00713     {
00714         D_ASSERT(var_array[i].inDomain(varvalmatching[i]));
00715         for(int j=i+1; j<numvars; j++)
00716         {
00717             D_ASSERT(varvalmatching[i]!=varvalmatching[j]);
00718             D_ASSERT(SCCs[i]!=SCCs[j]);
00719         }
00720         D_ASSERT(SCCSplit.isMember(i) == (((char*)SCCSplit2.get_ptr())[i]==1));
00721         D_ASSERT(SCCs[varToSCCIndex[i]]==i);
00722     }
00723     #endif
00724     
00725     // Call Tarjan's for each disturbed SCC.
00726     {
00727     vector<int> & toiterate=sccs_to_process.getlist();
00728     for(int i=0; i<toiterate.size(); i++)
00729     {
00730         int j=toiterate[i];
00731         
00732         // remake var_indices for this SCC.
00733         var_indices.clear();
00734         for(int k=j; k<numvars; k++)
00735         {
00736             #ifdef CHECKDOMSIZE
00737             if(!var_array[SCCs[k]].inDomain(varvalmatching[SCCs[k]]))
00738             {
00739                 int l=j; while(SCCSplit.isMember(l) && l<(numvars-1)) l++;
00740                 if(!matching_wrapper(j, l))
00741                     return;
00742             }
00743             #endif
00744             
00745             var_indices.push_back(SCCs[k]);
00746             if(!SCCSplit.isMember(k)) break;
00747         }
00748         
00749         //cout << "Running tarjan's on component "<< var_indices <<endl;
00750         tarjan_recursive(j);
00751     }
00752     }
00753     
00754     
00755     //  print components out
00756     
00757     /*
00758     cout<<"SCCs:"<<endl;
00759     for(int i=0; i<SCCs.size(); i++)
00760     {
00761         cout<< SCCs[i] <<endl;
00762     }
00763     cout<<"SCCSplit:"<<endl;
00764     for(int i=0; i<SCCs.size(); i++)
00765     {
00766         cout << ((SCCSplit.isMember(i))?"Nosplit":"Split") <<endl;
00767     }*/
00768     
00769     return;
00770   }
00771   
00772   // Simpler version which does not maintain SCCs and simply calls hopcroft and
00773   // visit for the whole set of variables.
00774   void do_prop_noscc()
00775   {
00776     PROP_INFO_ADDONE(AlldiffGacSlow);
00777     
00778     #ifdef DYNAMICALLDIFF
00779     bt_triggers_start=dynamic_trigger_start()+numvars;
00780     #endif
00781     
00782     #ifndef INCREMENTALMATCH
00783     // clear the matching.
00784     for(int i=0; i<numvars && i<numvals; i++)
00785     {
00786       varvalmatching[i]=i+dom_min;
00787       valvarmatching[i]=i;
00788     }
00789     #endif
00790     
00791     #ifdef PLONG
00792     cout << "Entering do_prop."<<endl;
00793     cout << "Varvalmatching:" <<varvalmatching<<endl;
00794     cout << "SCCs:" << SCCs <<endl;
00795     cout << "SCCSplit: ";
00796     for(int i=0; i<numvars; i++)
00797     {
00798         cout << (SCCSplit.isMember(i)?"1, ":"0, ");
00799     }
00800     cout <<endl;
00801     cout << "varToSCCIndex: "<< varToSCCIndex<<endl;
00802     cout << "Domains (remember that the var array is reversed):" <<endl;
00803     for(int i=0; i<numvars; i++)
00804     {
00805         cout << "var:" << i << " vals:" ;
00806         for(int j=dom_min; j<=dom_max; j++)
00807         {
00808             if(var_array[i].inDomain(j))
00809             {
00810                 cout << j <<", ";
00811             }
00812         }
00813         cout << endl;
00814     }
00815     
00816     // Check the matching is valid.
00817     for(int i=0; i<numvars; i++)
00818     {
00819         if(!var_array[i].inDomain(varvalmatching[i]))
00820         {
00821             cout << "val in matching removed, var: " << i << ", val:" << varvalmatching[i] <<endl;
00822         }
00823         for(int j=i+1; j<numvars; j++)
00824         {
00825             D_ASSERT(varvalmatching[i]!=varvalmatching[j]);
00826             D_ASSERT(SCCs[i]!=SCCs[j]);
00827         }
00828         D_ASSERT(SCCSplit.isMember(i) == (((char*)SCCSplit2.get_ptr())[i]==1));
00829         cout << (int)SCCSplit.isMember(i) << ", " << (int) (((char*)SCCSplit2.get_ptr())[i]==1) << endl;
00830         // The matches correspond.
00831         D_ASSERT(valvarmatching[varvalmatching[i]-dom_min]==i);
00832     }
00833     
00834     #ifdef DYNAMICALLDIFF
00835     // Can't yet check all the watches are in the right place, but can check
00836     // there are the right number of them on each var.
00837     for(int i=0; i<var_array.size(); i++)
00838     {
00839         int count=0;
00840         DynamicTrigger* trig=get_dt(i, 0);
00841         while(trig->queue!=NULL && count<numvals)
00842         {
00843             count++;
00844             if(count<numvals) trig=get_dt(i,count);
00845         }
00846         D_ASSERT(count==watches[i].size());
00847     }
00848     #endif
00849     
00850     // Check that if an element of the matching is removed, then the var is 
00851     // in to_process.
00852     for(int i=0; i<var_array.size(); i++)
00853     {
00854         if(!var_array[i].inDomain(varvalmatching[i]))
00855         {
00856             D_ASSERT(to_process.in(i));
00857         }
00858     }
00859     #endif
00860     
00861     // Call hopcroft for the whole matching.
00862     if(!matching_wrapper(0, numvars-1))
00863         return;
00864     
00865     #ifdef DYNAMICALLDIFF
00866     // sync the watches to the matching, 
00867     // since the matching has just changed.
00868     #ifndef BTMATCHING
00869     DynamicTrigger * trig = dynamic_trigger_start();
00870     for(int j=0; j<numvars; j++)
00871     {
00872         var_array[j].addWatchTrigger(trig + j, DomainRemoval, varvalmatching[j]);
00873     }
00874     #endif
00875     #endif
00876     
00877     P("Fixed varvalmatching:" << varvalmatching);
00878     
00879     // now both varvalmatching and valvarmatching contain 
00880     // a complete matching for the SCC.
00881     // Also, valinlocalmatching contains the domain values
00882     // used in this SCC.
00883     
00884     #ifndef NO_DEBUG
00885     // Check the matching is valid.
00886     for(int i=0; i<numvars; i++)
00887     {
00888         D_ASSERT(var_array[i].inDomain(varvalmatching[i]));
00889         for(int j=i+1; j<numvars; j++)
00890         {
00891             D_ASSERT(varvalmatching[i]!=varvalmatching[j]);
00892             D_ASSERT(SCCs[i]!=SCCs[j]);
00893         }
00894         D_ASSERT(SCCSplit.isMember(i) == (((char*)SCCSplit2.get_ptr())[i]==1));
00895         D_ASSERT(SCCs[varToSCCIndex[i]]==i);
00896     }
00897     #endif
00898     
00899     
00900     // Call Tarjan's for all vars
00901     
00902     var_indices.clear();
00903     for(int i=0; i<numvars; i++) var_indices.push_back(i);
00904     
00905     tarjan_recursive(0);
00906     
00907     return;
00908   }
00909   
00910   inline bool greedymatch(int tempvar, int sccindex_start, int sccindex_end)
00911   {
00912     D_ASSERT(!var_array[tempvar].inDomain(varvalmatching[tempvar]));
00913     
00914     valinlocalmatching.clear();
00915     for(int j=sccindex_start; j<=sccindex_end; j++)
00916     {
00917         valinlocalmatching.insert(varvalmatching[SCCs[j]]-dom_min);
00918     }
00919     
00920     for(int val=var_array[tempvar].getMin(); val<=var_array[tempvar].getMax(); val++)
00921     {
00922         if(var_array[tempvar].inDomain(val) && !valinlocalmatching.in(val-dom_min))
00923         {
00924             varvalmatching[tempvar]=val;
00925             valvarmatching[val-dom_min]=tempvar;
00926             return true;
00927         }
00928     }
00929     return false;
00930   }
00931   
00932   inline bool greedymatch2(int , int sccindex_start, int sccindex_end)
00933   {
00934       // process all the broken matchings.
00935     
00936     valinlocalmatching.clear();
00937     for(int j=sccindex_start; j<=sccindex_end; j++)
00938     {
00939         valinlocalmatching.insert(varvalmatching[SCCs[j]]-dom_min);
00940     }
00941     
00942     for(int j=sccindex_start; j<=sccindex_end; j++)
00943     {
00944         int tempvar=SCCs[j];
00945         
00946         if(var_array[tempvar].inDomain(varvalmatching[tempvar]))
00947         {
00948             bool found=false;
00949             for(int val=var_array[tempvar].getMin(); val<=var_array[tempvar].getMax(); val++)
00950             {
00951                 if(var_array[tempvar].inDomain(val) && !valinlocalmatching.in(val-dom_min))
00952                 {
00953                     varvalmatching[tempvar]=val;
00954                     valvarmatching[val-dom_min]=tempvar;
00955                     valinlocalmatching.insert(val-dom_min);
00956                     found=true;
00957                     break;
00958                 }
00959             }
00960             if(!found)
00961             {
00962                 return false;
00963             }
00964         }
00965     }
00966     
00967     return true;
00968   }
00969   
00970   virtual BOOL full_check_unsat()
00971   { 
00972     int v_size = var_array.size();
00973     for(int i = 0; i < v_size; ++i)
00974     {
00975       if(var_array[i].isAssigned())
00976       {
00977       
00978         for(int j = i + 1; j < v_size; ++j)
00979         {
00980           if(var_array[j].isAssigned())
00981           {
00982             if(var_array[i].getAssignedValue() == var_array[j].getAssignedValue())
00983               return true;
00984           }
00985         }
00986         
00987       }
00988     }
00989     
00990     return false;
00991   }
00992   
00993   virtual BOOL check_unsat(int i, DomainDelta)
00994   {
00995     int v_size = var_array.size();
00996     if(!var_array[i].isAssigned()) return false;
00997     
00998     DomainInt assign_val = var_array[i].getAssignedValue();
00999     for(int loop = 0; loop < v_size; ++loop)
01000     {
01001       if(loop != i)
01002       {
01003         if(var_array[loop].isAssigned() && 
01004            var_array[loop].getAssignedValue() == assign_val)
01005         return true;
01006       }
01007     }
01008     return false;
01009   }
01010   
01011   virtual void full_propagate()
01012   { 
01013       #ifdef INCGRAPH
01014         {
01015             // update the adjacency lists. and place dts
01016             DynamicTrigger* dt=dynamic_trigger_start();
01017             #ifdef DYNAMICALLDIFF
01018             dt+=numvars+numvars*numvals;
01019             #endif
01020             for(int i=dom_min; i<=dom_max; i++)
01021             {
01022                 for(int j=0; j<adjlistlength[i-dom_min+numvars]; j++)
01023                 {
01024                     int var=adjlist[i-dom_min+numvars][j];
01025                     if(!var_array[var].inDomain(i))
01026                     {
01027                         adjlist_remove(var, i);
01028                         j--; // stay in the same place, dont' skip over the 
01029                         // value which was just swapped into the current position.
01030                     }
01031                     else
01032                     {
01033                         // arranged in blocks for each variable, with numvals triggers in each block
01034                         DynamicTrigger* mydt= dt+(var*numvals)+(i-dom_min);
01035                         var_array[var].addDynamicTrigger(mydt, DomainRemoval, i);
01036                     }
01037                 }
01038             }
01039         }
01040       #endif
01041       
01042       #if defined(USEWATCHES) && defined(CHECKDOMSIZE)
01043       cout << "Watches and Quimper&Walsh's criterion do not safely co-exist." <<endl;
01044       FAIL_EXIT();
01045       #endif
01046       
01047       #if defined(DYNAMICALLDIFF) && !defined(USEWATCHES)
01048       cout << "watchedalldiff does not work if USEWATCHES is not defined." << endl;
01049       FAIL_EXIT();
01050       #endif
01051       
01052       // Is this guaranteed to be called before do_prop is ever called??
01053       // I hope so, because the following test has to be done first.
01054       if(numvars>numvals)
01055       {
01056           getState(stateObj).setFailed(true);
01057           return;
01058       }
01059       
01060       // process all variables.
01061       to_process.clear();    // It seems like this is called twice at the top of the tree, so the clear is necessary.
01062       
01063       for(int i=0; i<numvars; i++)
01064       {
01065           to_process.insert(i);
01066       }
01067       
01068       #ifdef DYNAMICALLDIFF
01069         // Clear all the BT triggers. This is so that the tests at
01070         // the start of do_prop will work.
01071         bt_triggers_start=dynamic_trigger_start()+numvars;
01072         for(int i=0; i<var_indices.size(); i++)
01073         {
01074             int var=var_indices[i];
01075             for(int j=triggercount[var]; j<numvals; j++)
01076             {
01077                 if( get_dt(var, j)->queue == NULL)
01078                 {
01079                     break;
01080                 }
01081                 get_dt(var, j)->sleepDynamicTriggerBT(stateObj);
01082             }
01083         }
01084         
01085       // set the variable numbers in the watches.
01086       DynamicTrigger * trig=dynamic_trigger_start();
01087       for(int i=0; i<numvars; i++)
01088       {
01089           (trig+i)->trigger_info() = i;
01090       }
01091       for(int i=0; i<numvars; i++)
01092       {
01093           for(int j=0; j<numvals; j++)
01094           {
01095               (trig+numvars+(i*numvals)+j)->trigger_info() = i;
01096           }
01097       }
01098       
01099       #ifndef BTMATCHING
01100       // set the watches here so that they start synced to the varvalmatching.
01101         trig = dynamic_trigger_start();
01102         for(int j=0; j<numvars; j++)
01103         {
01104             var_array[j].addWatchTrigger(trig + j, DomainRemoval, varvalmatching[j]);
01105             P("Adding watch for var " << j << " val " << varvalmatching[j]);
01106         }
01107       #endif
01108       #endif
01109       
01110       #ifdef SCC
01111       do_prop();
01112       #else
01113       do_prop_noscc();
01114       #endif
01115   }
01116     
01117   #ifdef INCGRAPH
01118     inline void adjlist_remove(int var, int val)
01119     {
01120         // swap item at position varidx to the end, then reduce the length by 1.
01121         int validx=val-dom_min+numvars;
01122         int varidx=adjlistpos[validx][var];
01123         D_ASSERT(varidx<adjlistlength[validx]);  // var is actually in the list.
01124         delfromlist(validx, varidx);
01125         
01126         delfromlist(var, adjlistpos[var][val-dom_min]);
01127     }
01128     
01129     inline void delfromlist(int i, int j)
01130     {
01131         // delete item in list i at position j
01132         int t=adjlist[i][adjlistlength[i]-1];
01133         adjlist[i][adjlistlength[i]-1]=adjlist[i][j];
01134         
01135         if(i<numvars)
01136         {
01137             adjlistpos[i][adjlist[i][j]-dom_min]=adjlistlength[i]-1;
01138             adjlistpos[i][t-dom_min]=j;
01139         }
01140         else
01141         {
01142             adjlistpos[i][adjlist[i][j]]=adjlistlength[i]-1;
01143             adjlistpos[i][t]=j;
01144         }
01145         adjlist[i][j]=t;
01146         adjlistlength[i]=adjlistlength[i]-1;
01147     }
01148     #endif
01149   
01150   
01151     virtual BOOL check_assignment(DomainInt* v, int array_size)
01152     {
01153       D_ASSERT(array_size == var_array.size());
01154       for(int i=0;i<array_size;i++)
01155         for( int j=i+1;j<array_size;j++)
01156           if(v[i]==v[j]) return false;
01157       return true;
01158     }
01159     
01160     virtual vector<AnyVarRef> get_vars()
01161     {
01162       vector<AnyVarRef> vars;
01163       vars.reserve(var_array.size());
01164       for(unsigned i = 0; i < var_array.size(); ++i)
01165         vars.push_back(var_array[i]);
01166       return vars;
01167     }
01168     
01169     
01170   virtual bool get_satisfying_assignment(box<pair<int,DomainInt> >& assignment)
01171   {
01172       bool matchok=true;
01173       for(int i=0; i<numvars; i++)
01174       {
01175           if(!var_array[i].inDomain(varvalmatching[i]))
01176           {
01177               matchok=false;
01178               break;
01179           }
01180       }
01181       
01182       if(!matchok)
01183       {
01184           if(numvals<numvars) return false; // there can't be a matching.
01185           #ifdef INCGRAPH
01186             // update the adjacency lists.
01187             for(int i=dom_min; i<=dom_max; i++)
01188             {
01189                 for(int j=0; j<adjlistlength[i-dom_min+numvars]; j++)
01190                 {
01191                     int var=adjlist[i-dom_min+numvars][j];
01192                     if(!var_array[var].inDomain(i))
01193                     {
01194                         // swap with the last element and remove
01195                         adjlist_remove(var, i);
01196                         j--; // stay in the same place, dont' skip over the 
01197                         // value which was just swapped into the current position.
01198                     }
01199                 }
01200             }
01201           #endif
01202           
01203           matchok=bfsmatching(0, numvars-1);
01204       }
01205       
01206       if(!matchok)
01207       {
01208           return false;
01209       }
01210       else
01211       {
01212           for(int i=0; i<numvars; i++)
01213           {
01214               assignment.push_back(make_pair(i, varvalmatching[i]));
01215           }
01216           return true;
01217       }
01218   }
01219     
01220     // ------------------------------- Targan's algorithm ------------------------------------
01221     // based on the following pseudocode from wikipedia.
01222         /*
01223         Input: Graph G = (V, E), Start node v0
01224 
01225         max_dfs := 0  // Counter for dfs
01226         U := V        // Collection of unvisited nodes
01227         S := {}       // An initially empty stack
01228         tarjan(v0)    // Call the function with the start node
01229         
01230         procedure tarjan(v)
01231         v.dfs := max_dfs;          // Set the depth index
01232         v.lowlink := max_dfs;      // v.lowlink <= v.dfs
01233         max_dfs := max_dfs + 1;    // Increment the counter
01234         S.push(v);                 // Place v on the stack
01235         U := U \ {v};              // Separate v from U
01236         forall (v, v') in E do     // Consider the neighboring nodes
01237           if (v' in U)
01238             tarjan(v');            // recursive call
01239             v.lowlink := min(v.lowlink, v'.lowlink);
01240           // Ask whether v' is on the stack 
01241           // by a clever constant time method
01242           // (for example, setting a flag on the node when it is pushed or popped) 
01243           elseif (v' in S)
01244             v.lowlink := min(v.lowlink, v'.dfs);
01245           end if
01246         end for
01247         if (v.lowlink = v.dfs)     // the root of a strongly connected component
01248           print "SZK:";
01249           repeat
01250             v' := S.pop;
01251             print v';
01252           until (v' = v);
01253         end if
01254         */
01255     
01256     vector<int> tstack;
01257     smallset_nolist in_tstack;
01258     smallset_nolist visited;
01259     vector<int> dfsnum;
01260     vector<int> lowlink;
01261     
01262     //vector<int> iterationstack;
01263     vector<int> curnodestack;
01264     
01265     #ifndef BTMATCHING
01266     vector<int> varvalmatching; // For each var, give the matching value.
01267     // valvarmatching is from val-dom_min to var.
01268     vector<int> valvarmatching;   // need to set size somewhere.
01269     // -1 means unmatched.
01270     #else
01271     MoveableArray<int> varvalmatching;
01272     MoveableArray<int> valvarmatching;
01273     #endif
01274     
01275     // Filled in before calling tarjan's.
01276     bool scc_split;
01277     
01278     int sccindex;
01279     
01280     int max_dfs;
01281     
01282     vector<int> spare_values;
01283     bool include_sink;
01284     vector<int> var_indices;  // Should be a pointer so it can be changed.
01285     
01286     smallset sccs_to_process;   // Indices to the first var in the SCC to process.
01287     
01288     int varcount;
01289     
01290     #ifdef DYNAMICALLDIFF
01291     vector<int> triggercount; // number of triggers on the variable
01292     DynamicTrigger * bt_triggers_start;   // points at dynamic_trigger_start()+numvars
01293     #endif
01294     
01295     // An integer represents a vertex, where 0 .. numvars-1 represent the vars,
01296     // numvars .. numvars+numvals-1 represents the values (val-dom_min+numvars),
01297     // numvars+numvals is the sink,
01298     // numvars+numvals+1 is the 
01299     
01300     void initialize_tarjan()
01301     {
01302         int numnodes=numvars+numvals+1;  // One sink node.
01303         tstack.reserve(numnodes);
01304         in_tstack.reserve(numnodes);
01305         visited.reserve(numnodes);
01306         max_dfs=1;
01307         scc_split=false;
01308         dfsnum.resize(numnodes);
01309         lowlink.resize(numnodes);
01310         
01311         //iterationstack.resize(numnodes);
01312         curnodestack.reserve(numnodes);
01313         #ifdef DYNAMICALLDIFF
01314         triggercount.resize(numvars);
01315         #endif
01316     }
01317     
01318     void tarjan_recursive(int sccindex_start)
01319     {
01320         
01321         valinlocalmatching.clear();
01322         
01323         int localmax=var_array[var_indices[0]].getMax();
01324         int localmin=var_array[var_indices[0]].getMin();
01325         valinlocalmatching.insert(varvalmatching[var_indices[0]]-dom_min);
01326         
01327         for(int i=1; i<var_indices.size(); i++)
01328         {
01329             int tempvar=var_indices[i];
01330             int tempmax=var_array[tempvar].getMax();
01331             int tempmin=var_array[tempvar].getMin();
01332             if(tempmax>localmax) localmax=tempmax;
01333             if(tempmin<localmin) localmin=tempmin;
01334             valinlocalmatching.insert(varvalmatching[var_indices[i]]-dom_min);
01335         }
01336         
01337         if(usewatches())
01338         {
01339             for(int i=0; i<var_indices.size(); i++)
01340             {
01341                 #if !defined(DYNAMICALLDIFF) || !defined(NO_DEBUG)
01342                 watches[var_indices[i]].clear();
01343                 P("Adding DT for var " << var_indices[i] << " val " << varvalmatching[var_indices[i]]);
01344                 // watch the value from the matching.
01345                 watches[var_indices[i]].insert(varvalmatching[var_indices[i]]-dom_min);
01346                 #endif
01347                 
01348                 #ifdef DYNAMICALLDIFF
01349                 // Clear all the triggers on this variable. At end now.
01350                 int var=var_indices[i];
01351                 triggercount[var]=1;
01352                 
01353                 var_array[var].addDynamicTriggerBT(get_dt(var, 0), 
01354                     DomainRemoval, varvalmatching[var]);
01355                 P("Adding DT for var " << var_indices[i] << " val " << varvalmatching[var_indices[i]]);
01356                 #endif
01357             }
01358         }
01359         
01360         // spare_values
01361         // This should be computed somehow on demand because it might not be used.
01362         // Actually it should be used exactly once.
01363         #ifdef SPAREVALUESOPT
01364         if(sparevaluespresent.isMember(sccindex_start))
01365         {
01366         #endif
01367             spare_values.clear();
01368             for(int val=localmin; val<=localmax; ++val)
01369             {
01370                 if(!valinlocalmatching.in(val-dom_min))
01371                 {
01372                     for(int j=0; j<var_indices.size(); j++)
01373                     {
01374                         if(var_array[var_indices[j]].inDomain(val))
01375                         {
01376                             spare_values.push_back(val-dom_min+numvars);
01377                             break;
01378                         }
01379                     }
01380                 }
01381             }
01382             //cout << "With spare values "<< spare_values <<endl;
01383             
01384             include_sink= (spare_values.size()>0);  // This should be in the TMS.
01385         #ifdef SPAREVALUESOPT    
01386             if(!include_sink)
01387             {
01388                 // Set some bits in sparevaluespresent.
01389                 for(int scci=sccindex_start; ; scci++)
01390                 {
01391                     D_ASSERT(sparevaluespresent.isMember(scci));
01392                     sparevaluespresent.remove(scci);
01393                     if(!SCCSplit.isMember(scci))  // means this is the last element
01394                     {
01395                         break;
01396                     }
01397                 }
01398             }
01399         }
01400         else
01401         {
01402             include_sink=false;
01403         }
01404         #endif
01405         // Just generate the spare_values if no empty sets have been seen above
01406         // in this branch.
01407         
01408         tstack.clear();
01409         in_tstack.clear();
01410         
01411         visited.clear();
01412         max_dfs=1;
01413         
01414         scc_split=false;
01415         sccindex=sccindex_start;
01416         
01417         for(int i=0; i<var_indices.size(); ++i)
01418         {
01419             int curnode=var_indices[i];
01420             if(!visited.in(curnode))
01421             {
01422                 P("(Re)starting tarjan's algorithm, value:"<< curnode);
01423                 varcount=0;
01424                 visit(curnode, true, sccindex_start);
01425                 P("Returned from tarjan's algorithm.");
01426             }
01427         }
01428         
01429         // Clear any extra watches.
01430         #ifdef DYNAMICALLDIFF
01431         if(usewatches())
01432         {
01433             for(int i=0; i<var_indices.size(); i++)
01434             {
01435                 int var=var_indices[i];
01436                 for(int j=triggercount[var]; j<numvals; j++)
01437                 {
01438                     if( get_dt(var, j)->queue == NULL)
01439                     {
01440                         break;
01441                     }
01442                     get_dt(var, j)->sleepDynamicTriggerBT(stateObj);
01443                 }
01444             }
01445         }
01446         #endif
01447     }
01448     
01449     void visit(int curnode, bool toplevel, int sccindex_start)
01450     {
01451         tstack.push_back(curnode);
01452         in_tstack.insert(curnode);
01453         dfsnum[curnode]=max_dfs;
01454         lowlink[curnode]=max_dfs;
01455         max_dfs++;
01456         visited.insert(curnode);
01457         //cout << "Visiting node: " <<curnode<<endl;
01458         
01459         if(curnode==numvars+numvals)
01460         {
01461             //cout << "Visiting sink node." <<endl;
01462             D_ASSERT(include_sink);
01463             // It's the sink so it links to all spare values.
01464             
01465             for(int i=0; i<spare_values.size(); ++i)
01466             {
01467                 int newnode=spare_values[i];
01468                 //cout << "About to visit spare value: " << newnode-numvars+dom_min <<endl;
01469                 if(!visited.in(newnode))
01470                 {
01471                     visit(newnode, false, sccindex_start);
01472                     if(lowlink[newnode]<lowlink[curnode])
01473                     {
01474                         lowlink[curnode]=lowlink[newnode];
01475                     }
01476                 }
01477                 else
01478                 {
01479                     // Already visited newnode
01480                     if(in_tstack.in(newnode) && dfsnum[newnode]<lowlink[curnode])
01481                     {
01482                         lowlink[curnode]=dfsnum[newnode];
01483                     }
01484                 }
01485             }
01486         }
01487         else if(curnode<numvars)  // This case should never occur with merge nodes.
01488         {
01489             D_ASSERT(find(var_indices.begin(), var_indices.end(), curnode)!=var_indices.end());
01490             varcount++;
01491             //cout << "Visiting node variable: "<< curnode<<endl;
01492             int newnode=varvalmatching[curnode]-dom_min+numvars;
01493             D_ASSERT(var_array[curnode].inDomain(newnode+dom_min-numvars));
01494             
01495             if(!visited.in(newnode))
01496             {
01497                 visit(newnode, false, sccindex_start);
01498                 if(lowlink[newnode]<lowlink[curnode])
01499                 {
01500                     lowlink[curnode]=lowlink[newnode];
01501                 }
01502             }
01503             else
01504             {
01505                 // Already visited newnode
01506                 if(in_tstack.in(newnode) && dfsnum[newnode]<lowlink[curnode])
01507                 {
01508                     lowlink[curnode]=dfsnum[newnode];  // Why dfsnum not lowlink?
01509                 }
01510             }
01511         }
01512         else
01513         {
01514             // curnode is a value
01515             // This is the only case where watches are set.
01516             //cout << "Visiting node val: "<< curnode+dom_min-numvars <<endl;
01517             
01518             D_ASSERT(curnode>=numvars && curnode<(numvars+numvals));
01519             #ifndef NO_DEBUG
01520             bool found=false;
01521             for(int i=0; i<var_indices.size(); i++)
01522             {
01523                 if(var_array[var_indices[i]].inDomain(curnode+dom_min-numvars))
01524                 {
01525                     found=true;
01526                 }
01527             }
01528             D_ASSERT(found);
01529             #endif
01530             
01531             int lowlinkvar=-1;
01532             #ifndef INCGRAPH
01533             for(int i=0; i<var_indices.size(); i++)
01534             {
01535                 int newnode=var_indices[i];
01536             #else
01537             for(int i=0; i<adjlistlength[curnode]; i++)
01538             {
01539                 int newnode=adjlist[curnode][i];
01540             #endif
01541                 if(varvalmatching[newnode]!=curnode-numvars+dom_min)   // if the value is not in the matching.
01542                 {
01543                     #ifndef INCGRAPH
01544                     if(var_array[newnode].inDomain(curnode+dom_min-numvars))
01545                     #endif
01546                     {
01547                         D_ASSERT(var_array[newnode].inDomain(curnode+dom_min-numvars));
01548                         //newnode=varvalmatching[newnode]-dom_min+numvars;  // Changed here for merge nodes
01549                         if(!visited.in(newnode))
01550                         {
01551                             // set a watch
01552                             if(usewatches())
01553                             {
01554                                 P("Adding DT for var " << newnode << " val " << curnode-numvars+dom_min);
01555                                 
01556                                 #if !defined(DYNAMICALLDIFF) || !defined(NO_DEBUG)
01557                                 watches[newnode].insert(curnode-numvars);
01558                                 #endif
01559                                 
01560                                 #ifdef DYNAMICALLDIFF
01561                                 var_array[newnode].addDynamicTriggerBT(get_dt(newnode, triggercount[newnode]), 
01562                                     DomainRemoval, curnode-numvars+dom_min);
01563                                 triggercount[newnode]++;
01564                                 #endif
01565                             }
01566                             visit(newnode, false, sccindex_start);
01567                             if(lowlink[newnode]<lowlink[curnode])
01568                             {
01569                                 lowlink[curnode]=lowlink[newnode];
01570                                 lowlinkvar=-1;   // Would be placing a watch where there already is one.
01571                             }
01572                         }
01573                         else
01574                         {
01575                             // Already visited newnode
01576                             if(in_tstack.in(newnode) && dfsnum[newnode]<lowlink[curnode])
01577                             {
01578                                 lowlink[curnode]=dfsnum[newnode];
01579                                 lowlinkvar=newnode;
01580                             }
01581                         }
01582                     }
01583                 }
01584             }
01585             
01586             
01587             
01588             // Why the find? Can we not use some DS which is already lying around?
01589             // And why does it include the whole matching in the find??
01590             if(include_sink && valinlocalmatching.in(curnode-numvars))
01591             //    find(varvalmatching.begin(), varvalmatching.end(), curnode+dom_min-numvars)!=varvalmatching.end())
01592             {
01593                 int newnode=numvars+numvals;
01594                 if(!visited.in(newnode))
01595                 {
01596                     visit(newnode, false, sccindex_start);
01597                     if(lowlink[newnode]<lowlink[curnode])
01598                     {
01599                         lowlink[curnode]=lowlink[newnode];
01600                         lowlinkvar=-1;
01601                     }
01602                 }
01603                 else
01604                 {
01605                     // Already visited newnode
01606                     if(in_tstack.in(newnode) && dfsnum[newnode]<lowlink[curnode])
01607                     {
01608                         lowlink[curnode]=dfsnum[newnode];
01609                         lowlinkvar=-1;
01610                     }
01611                 }
01612             }
01613             
01614             // Where did the low link value come from? insert that edge into watches.
01615             if(usewatches() && lowlinkvar!=-1)
01616             {
01617                 P("Adding DT for var " << lowlinkvar << " val " << curnode-numvars+dom_min);
01618                 
01619                 #if !defined(DYNAMICALLDIFF) || !defined(NO_DEBUG)
01620                 watches[lowlinkvar].insert(curnode-numvars);
01621                 #endif
01622                 #ifdef DYNAMICALLDIFF
01623                 var_array[lowlinkvar].addDynamicTriggerBT(get_dt(lowlinkvar, triggercount[lowlinkvar]), 
01624                     DomainRemoval, curnode-numvars+dom_min);
01625                 triggercount[lowlinkvar]++;
01626                 #endif
01627             }
01628         }
01629         
01630         //cout << "On way back up, curnode:" << curnode<< ", lowlink:"<<lowlink[curnode]<< ", dfsnum:"<<dfsnum[curnode]<<endl;
01631         if(lowlink[curnode]==dfsnum[curnode])
01632         {
01633             // Did the SCC split?
01634             // Perhaps we traversed all vars but didn't unroll the recursion right to the top.
01635             // Then lowlink[curnode]!=1. Or perhaps we didn't traverse all the variables.
01636             // I think these two cases cover everything.
01637             if(!toplevel || varcount<var_indices.size())
01638             {
01639                 scc_split=true;  // The SCC has split and there is some work to do later.
01640             }
01641             
01642             // Doing something with the components should not be necessary unless the scc has split.
01643             // The first SCC found is deep in the tree, so the flag will be set to its final value
01644             // the first time we are here.
01645             // so it is OK to assume that scc_split has been
01646             // set correctly before we do the following.
01647             if(scc_split)
01648             {
01649                 // For each variable, write it to the scc array.
01650                 // If its the last one, flip the bit.
01651                 
01652                 varinlocalmatching.clear();  // Borrow this datastructure for a minute.
01653                 
01654                 P("Writing new SCC:");
01655                 bool containsvars=false;
01656                 for(vector<int>::iterator tstackit=(--tstack.end());  ; --tstackit)
01657                 {
01658                     int copynode=(*tstackit);
01659                     //cout << "SCC element: "<< copynode<<endl;
01660                     if(copynode<numvars)
01661                     {
01662                         containsvars=true;
01663                         SCCs[sccindex]=copynode;
01664                         varToSCCIndex[copynode]=sccindex;
01665                         sccindex++;
01666                         //tempset.push_back(copynode);  // need to write into sccs instead.
01667                         varinlocalmatching.insert(copynode);
01668                         P("Stored SCC element "<< copynode);
01669                     }
01670                     
01671                     if(copynode==curnode)
01672                     {
01673                         // Beware it might be an SCC containing just one value.
01674                         
01675                         if(containsvars)
01676                         {
01677                             P("Inserting split point.");
01678                             SCCSplit.remove(sccindex-1);
01679                             D_DATA(((char*)SCCSplit2.get_ptr())[sccindex-1]=0);
01680                         }
01681                         // The one written last was the last one in the SCC.
01682                         break;
01683                     }
01684                     
01685                     // Should be no split points in the middle of writing an SCC.
01686                     //D_ASSERT(copynode==curnode || copynode>=numvars || SCCSplit.isMember(sccindex-1));
01687                 }
01688                 // Just print more stuff here.
01689                 
01690                 
01691                 // For each value, iterate through the current
01692                 // SCC and remove it from any other variable other
01693                 // than the one in this SCC.
01694                 //cout << "Starting loop"<<endl;
01695                 //if(containsvars) // why is this OK? because of bug above, in case where numnode is a variable.
01696                 {
01697                     while(true)
01698                     {
01699                         int copynode=(*(--tstack.end()));
01700                         
01701                         tstack.pop_back();
01702                         in_tstack.remove(copynode);
01703                         
01704                         if(copynode>=numvars && copynode!=(numvars+numvals))
01705                         {
01706                             // It's a value. Iterate through old SCC and remove it from
01707                             // any variables not in tempset.
01708                             //cout << "Trashing value "<< copynode+dom_min-numvars << endl;
01709                             for(int i=0; i<var_indices.size(); i++)
01710                             {
01711                                 int curvar=var_indices[i];
01712                                 if(!varinlocalmatching.in(curvar))
01713                                 {
01714                                     // var not in tempset so might have to do some test against matching.
01715                                     // Why doing this test? something wrong with the assigned variable optimization?
01716                                     if(varvalmatching[curvar]!=copynode+dom_min-numvars)
01717                                     {
01718                                         P("Removing var: "<< curvar << " val:" << copynode+dom_min-numvars);
01719                                         if(var_array[curvar].inDomain(copynode+dom_min-numvars))
01720                                         {
01721                                             var_array[curvar].removeFromDomain(copynode+dom_min-numvars);
01722                                             #ifdef INCGRAPH
01723                                                 adjlist_remove(curvar, copynode-numvars+dom_min);
01724                                             #endif
01725                                         }
01726                                     }
01727                                 }
01728                             }
01729                         }
01730                         
01731                         if(copynode==curnode)
01732                         {
01733                             break;
01734                         }
01735                     }
01736                 }
01737             }
01738         }
01739     }
01740     
01741   // -------------------------Hopcroft-Karp algorithm -----------------------------
01742   // Can be applied to a subset of var_array as required.
01743   
01744   // Each domain value has a label which is numvars+
01745   
01746   
01747   // These two are for the valvar version of hopcroft.
01748   smallset_nolist varinlocalmatching;    // indicates whether a var is recorded in localmatching.
01749   smallset valinlocalmatching;
01750   
01751   //smallset varinlocalmatching;    // indicates whether a var is recorded in localmatching.
01752   //smallset_nolist valinlocalmatching;
01753   
01754   
01755   // Uprevious (pred) gives (for each CSP value) the value-dom_min
01756   // it was matched to in the previous layer. If it was unmatched,
01757   // -1 is used.
01758   vector<int> uprevious;  // -2 means unset, -1 labelled unmatched. 
01759   
01760   vector<vector<int> > vprevious;  // map val-dom_min to vector of vars.
01761   smallset_nolist invprevious;     // is there a mapping in vprevious for val? Allows fast unset.
01762   
01763   smallset layer;
01764   smallset unmatched;   // contains vals-dom_min.
01765   
01766   vector<vector<int> > newlayer;
01767   smallset innewlayer;
01768   
01769   void initialize_hopcroft()
01770   {
01771       // Initialize all datastructures to do with hopcroft-karp
01772       // Surely could reduce the number of arrays etc used for hopcroft-karp??
01773       int numvals=dom_max-dom_min+1;
01774       
01775       varinlocalmatching.reserve(numvars);
01776       valinlocalmatching.reserve(numvals);
01777       uprevious.resize(numvars, -2);
01778       
01779       vprevious.resize(numvals);
01780       for(int i=0; i<numvals; ++i)
01781       {
01782           vprevious[i].reserve(numvars);
01783       }
01784       invprevious.reserve(numvals);
01785       
01786       layer.reserve(numvars);
01787       unmatched.reserve(numvals);
01788       
01789       newlayer.resize(numvals);
01790       for(int i=0; i<numvals; ++i)
01791       {
01792           newlayer[i].reserve(numvars);
01793       }
01794       innewlayer.reserve(numvals);
01795       
01796       // for BFS algorithm
01797       prev.resize(numvars+numvals, -1);
01798   }
01799   
01800   
01801     
01802 // ------------------------- Hopcroft which takes start and end indices.
01803     
01804     inline bool matching_wrapper(int sccstart, int sccend)
01805     {
01806         #ifdef BFSMATCHING
01807         return bfs_wrapper(sccstart,sccend);
01808         #else
01809         return hopcroft_wrapper(sccstart,sccend);
01810         #endif
01811     }
01812 
01813     inline bool hopcroft_wrapper(int sccstart, int sccend)
01814     {
01815         // Call hopcroft for the whole matching.
01816         if(!hopcroft(sccstart, sccend))
01817         {
01818             // The constraint is unsatisfiable (no matching).
01819             P("About to fail. Changed varvalmatching: "<< varvalmatching);
01820             
01821             // temporary mess to see if hopcroft is failing prematurely.
01822             /*vector<int> t=varvalmatching;
01823             vector<int> t2=valvarmatching;
01824             if(bfs_wrapper(sccstart, sccend))
01825             {
01826                 cout << "BFS fixed matching, but hopcroft did not!" <<endl;
01827                 cout << "hopcroft varvalmatching:"<< t<<endl;
01828                 cout << "hopcroft valvarmatching:"<< t2<<endl;
01829                 cout << "BFS varvalmatching:" << varvalmatching <<endl;
01830                 
01831                 {vector<int>& toiterate=valinlocalmatching.getlist();
01832                     for(int j=0; j<toiterate.size(); j++)
01833                     {
01834                         int tempval=toiterate[j];
01835                         t[t2[tempval]]=tempval+dom_min;
01836                     }
01837                 }
01838                 cout << "copied back hopcroft varvalmatching:" << t <<endl;
01839                 
01840                 BOOL bfsflag=true, hopflag=true;
01841                 for(int scci=sccstart; scci<=sccend; scci++)
01842                 {
01843                     if(!var_array[SCCs[scci]].inDomain(t[SCCs[scci]]))
01844                         hopflag=false;
01845                     if(!var_array[SCCs[scci]].inDomain(t[SCCs[scci]]))
01846                         bfsflag=false;
01847                 }
01848                 cout << "hopcroft matching valid: "<< hopflag <<endl;
01849                 cout << "bfs matching valid: "<< bfsflag <<endl;
01850             }*/
01851             
01852             for(int j=0; j<numvars; j++)
01853             {
01854                 // Restore valvarmatching because it might be messed up by Hopcroft.
01855                 valvarmatching[varvalmatching[j]-dom_min]=j;
01856             }
01857             
01858             getState(stateObj).setFailed(true);
01859             return false;
01860         }
01861         
01862         // Here, copy from valvarmatching to varvalmatching.
01863         // Using valinlocalmatching left over from hopcroft.
01864         // This must not be done when failing, because it might mess
01865         // up varvalmatching for the next invocation.
01866         {vector<int>& toiterate=valinlocalmatching.getlist();
01867             for(int j=0; j<toiterate.size(); j++)
01868             {
01869                 int tempval=toiterate[j];
01870                 varvalmatching[valvarmatching[tempval]]=tempval+dom_min;
01871             }
01872         }
01873         return true;
01874     }
01875     
01876     inline bool hopcroft(int sccstart, int sccend)
01877     {
01878         // Domain value convention:
01879         // Within hopcroft and recurse,
01880         // a domain value is represented as val-dom_min always.
01881         
01882         // Variables are always represented as their index in
01883         // var_array. sccstart and sccend indicates which variables
01884         // we are allowed to use here.
01885         
01886         int localnumvars=sccend-sccstart+1;
01887         
01888         // Construct the valinlocalmatching for this SCC, checking each val
01889         // to see it's in the relevant domain.
01890         valinlocalmatching.clear();
01891         
01892         for(int i=sccstart; i<=sccend; i++)
01893         {
01894             int tempvar=SCCs[i];
01895             if(var_array[tempvar].inDomain(varvalmatching[tempvar]))
01896             {
01897                 valinlocalmatching.insert(varvalmatching[tempvar]-dom_min);
01898                 // Check the two matching arrays correspond.
01899                 //D_ASSERT(valvarmatching[varvalmatching[tempvar]-dom_min]==tempvar);
01900             }
01901         }
01902         
01903         /*# initialize greedy matching (redundant, but faster than full search)
01904         matching = {}
01905         for u in graph:
01906             for v in graph[u]:
01907                 if v not in matching:
01908                     matching[v] = u
01909                     break
01910         */
01911         
01912         if(valinlocalmatching.size()==localnumvars)
01913         {
01914             return true;
01915         }
01916         
01917         // uprevious == pred
01918         // vprevious == preds
01919         
01920         // need sets u and v
01921         // u is easy, v is union of domains[0..numvar-1]
01922         
01923         while(true)
01924         {
01925             /*
01926             preds = {}
01927             unmatched = []
01928             pred = dict([(u,unmatched) for u in graph])
01929             for v in matching:
01930                 del pred[matching[v]]
01931             layer = list(pred)
01932             */
01933             // Set up layer and uprevious.
01934             invprevious.clear();
01935             unmatched.clear();
01936             
01937             layer.clear();
01938             
01939             // Reconstruct varinlocalmatching here.
01940             // WHY end up with duplicates in valvarmatching here???????
01941             // Because it's left over from a bad state when do_prop was last invoked, and failed.
01942             varinlocalmatching.clear();
01943             {
01944                 vector<int>& toiterate=valinlocalmatching.getlist();
01945                 for(int i=0; i<toiterate.size(); ++i)
01946                 {
01947                     if(!varinlocalmatching.in(valvarmatching[toiterate[i]]))   // This should not be conditional --BUG
01948                         varinlocalmatching.insert(valvarmatching[toiterate[i]]);
01949                 }
01950             }
01951             
01952             for(int i=sccstart; i<=sccend; ++i)
01953             {
01954                 int tempvar=SCCs[i];
01955                 if(varinlocalmatching.in(tempvar))  // The only use of varinlocalmatching.
01956                 {
01957                     uprevious[tempvar]=-2;   // Out of uprevious
01958                 }
01959                 else
01960                 {
01961                     layer.insert(tempvar);
01962                     uprevious[tempvar]=-1;  // In layer, and set to unmatched in uprevious.
01963                 }
01964             }
01965             
01966             /*cout<< "Uprevious:" <<endl;
01967             for(int i=0; i<localnumvars; ++i)
01968             {
01969                 cout<< "for variable "<<var_indices[i]<<" value "<< uprevious[i]<<endl;
01970             }*/
01971             
01972             // we have now calculated layer
01973             /*
01974             while layer and not unmatched:
01975                 newLayer = {}
01976             */
01977             
01978             while(layer.size()!=0 && unmatched.size()==0)
01979             {
01980                 innewlayer.clear();
01981                 
01982                 /*
01983                 for u in layer:
01984                     for v in graph[u]:
01985                         if v not in preds:
01986                             newLayer.setdefault(v,[]).append(u)
01987                 */
01988                 {
01989                 vector<int>& toiterate=layer.getlist();
01990                 for(int i=0; i<toiterate.size(); ++i)
01991                 {
01992                     //cout<<"Layer item: "<<(*setit)<<endl;
01993                     int tempvar=toiterate[i];
01994                     for(DomainInt realval=var_array[tempvar].getMin(); realval<=var_array[tempvar].getMax(); realval++)
01995                     {
01996                         if(var_array[tempvar].inDomain(realval))
01997                         {
01998                             int tempval=realval-dom_min;
01999                             
02000                             if(!invprevious.in(tempval))  // if tempval not found in vprevious
02001                             {
02002                                 if(!innewlayer.in(tempval))
02003                                 {
02004                                     innewlayer.insert(tempval);
02005                                     newlayer[tempval].clear();
02006                                 }
02007                                 newlayer[tempval].push_back(tempvar);
02008                             }
02009                         }
02010                     }
02011                 }
02012                 }
02013                 /*
02014                 layer = []
02015                 for v in newLayer:
02016                     preds[v] = newLayer[v]
02017                     if v in matching:
02018                         layer.append(matching[v])
02019                         pred[matching[v]] = v
02020                     else:
02021                         unmatched.append(v)
02022                 */
02023                 
02024                 layer.clear();
02025                 
02026                 /*cout<<"Local matching state:"<<endl;
02027                 {
02028                 vector<int>& toiterate = valinlocalmatching.getlist();
02029                 for(int i=0; i<toiterate.size(); ++i)
02030                 {
02031                     int temp=toiterate[i];
02032                     D_ASSERT(varinlocalmatching.in(localmatching[temp]));
02033                     cout << "mapping "<< localmatching[temp] << " to value " << temp <<endl; 
02034                 }
02035                 }*/
02036                 
02037                 {
02038                 vector<int>& toiterate = innewlayer.getlist();
02039                 for(int i=0; i<toiterate.size(); ++i)
02040                 {
02041                     int tempval = toiterate[i]; // for v in newlayer.
02042                     //cout << "Looping for value "<< tempval <<endl;
02043                     
02044                     D_ASSERT(innewlayer.in(tempval));
02045                     // insert mapping in vprevious
02046                     invprevious.insert(tempval);
02047                     
02048                     vprevious[tempval]=newlayer[tempval];  // This should be a copy???
02049                     /*vprevious[tempval].resize(newlayer[tempval].size());
02050                     for(int x=0; x<newlayer[tempval].size(); x++)
02051                     {
02052                         vprevious[tempval][x]=newlayer[tempval][x];
02053                     }*/
02054                     
02055                     if(valinlocalmatching.in(tempval))
02056                     {
02057                         int match=valvarmatching[tempval];
02058                         //cout << "Matched to variable:" << match << endl;
02059                         layer.insert(match);
02060                         uprevious[match]=tempval;
02061                     }
02062                     else
02063                     {
